data.title: Choose a sort order of directories and files according to the settings pattern
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
Version 1.10.2
Commit 8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331
Date 2017-03-08T14:00:46.854Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version:
Distributor ID: LinuxMint
Release: 18.1
Codename: serena
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Choose a sort order of directories and files according to the settings pattern. For example:

Based on this ASCII table from the 32 character
![asciifull](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9668277/24328640/edda2aa8-11c4-11e7-888d-7a0ca6c23f11.gif)

```
// ASCII pattern
"explorer.pathsSortOrders": [
    " ",
    "!",
    "#",
    // ...
    "@",
    "A",
    "B",
    "C",
    // ...
    "a",
    "b",
    "c",
    // ...
    "{",
    "|",
    "}",
    "~"
],
```

P.S.: Some IDE like phpStorm follows the above ASCII standard to sort directories and files of a project.

data.title: Chord not working when integrated terminal has focus
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Version 1.10.2
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
Windows 10 Enterprise

I want to overwrite the keyboard hotkey to toggle the integrated terminal ( ctrl+` ): everything works fine as long as the editor has focus, while if the terminal has focus the hotkey works only if it's NOT a chord

**Steps to Reproduce**:
This works fine
```
{
        "key": "ctrl+t",
        "command": "workbench.action.terminal.toggleTerminal"
}
```

This works only when editorTextFocus (the keys don't matter, I tried with multiple combinations)
```
{
        "key": "ctrl+t ctrl+t",
        "command": "workbench.action.terminal.toggleTerminal"
}
```
When editorTextFocus the integrated terminal is displayed and has the focus; press the chord again and nothing happens. Give the text editor focus again, press the chord and the integrated terminal is toggled once again

data.title: update docs wrt  settings and the when-clause
data.body:
As per [when clause specs](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/getstarted/keybindings#_when-clause-contexts), currently checking user/workspace settings is not supported in the when clause.
If it is indeed supported, please correct me, and no need to read the rest of the issue description.

Today, extensions can contribute to editor context menus. There are multiple features that can gain visibility via such menu which otherwise would be hard to discover by new users or even seasoned users who do not use the command pallet much. 

This can tempt extension authors to add more entries to editor context menu, which for some users might seem crowded and for others might seem a way to discover more features.

For the former, there is no way to disable these commands from the editor context menu.

Now, if the when clause that is used to contribute entries to such menus could support checking for settings, just like it supports checking the language type, then the user can decide if they want to see a particular command in their context menu or not.

Note, this would also sit very well with the below statement from the [VS Code Roadmap](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Roadmap#extension-creation-discovery-and-management)

> give users more control over how those extensions contribute to their environment.

data.title: vscode terminal disrespects `cls` command in windows
data.body:
say i have a batch file that starts with

```
cls 
```
which clears the output buffer of the console

when such batch file is run under vs the `cls` command gets ignored, the console still has all output from the previous commands

data.title: cannot launch compound but can launch all individual configs
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

I have 3 configs that each attach to a NodeJS v6.10.0 process that's run by [PM2](http://pm2.keymetrics.io/). If I Run and attach to each individually in VSC I can see the debugger attach and everything works great.  If I try to run the compound I get `Error : Request 'evaluate' was cancelled because Node.js is unresponsive.`

**NOTE** - I just switched from using the legacy NodeJS `--debug=50000` protocol to the inspector protocol `--inspect=50000` when this happened.  If I switch back to using the legacy I can launch the compound just fine.

- VSCode Version: Version 1.10.2 (1.10.2)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3 (16D32)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. npm i -g pm2@1.1.3
1. `pm2 start pm2.json`
1. `pm2 logs`
1. Start Visual Studio Code 
1. Select "API+Event+Rect" compound debug config and Hit Run
EXPECTED : VSC to attach to all 3.
ACTUAL : `Error : Request 'evaluate' was cancelled because Node.js is unresponsive.`

launch.json
```json
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "name": "API",
      "type": "node",
      "request": "attach",
      "port": 50001,
      "protocol": "inspector",
      "restart": true,
      "sourceMaps": true
    },
    {
      "name": "Events",
      "type": "node",
      "request": "attach",
      "port": 50002,
      "protocol": "inspector",
      "restart": true,
      "sourceMaps": true
    },
    {
      "name": "React",
      "type": "node",
      "request": "attach",
      "port": 50000,
      "protocol": "inspector",
      "restart": true,
      "sourceMaps": true
    }
  ],
  "compounds": [
    {
    "name": "API+Event+React",
    "configurations": ["API", "Events", "React"]
    }
  ]
}

```

pm2.json
```json
{
  "apps" : [{
    "name"        : "react",
    "script"      : "server.js",
    "cwd"     : "./react",
    "node_args": ["--inspect=50000"],
    "merge_logs"  : true
  },{
    "name"       : "api",
    "script"     : "start.js",
    "cwd"    : "./api",
    "node_args": ["--inspect=50001"],
    "merge_logs"  : true
  },
  {
    "name"       : "events",
    "script"     : "start.js",
    "cwd"    : "./events",
    "node_args": ["--inspect=50002"],
    "merge_logs"  : true
  }]
}
```

data.title: Quick access "Quad Menu" Feature?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
# **Quad What???? - What is the goal, you ask?**
>> ** To have quick access to more than 40-100 commands with 3-4 different button click combinations - this is powerfull **  <<


I want to request a feature for vs code - I've worked in many programs, also several 3d programs. In 3d we really need to access many functions, same as in vs code.

In these 3d programs there is something called a "Quad menu". Its equal to right click menu, just with 4 x times more space/actions you can trigger. See it here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R8Uc52rUtuc
https://i.stack.imgur.com/DDP5K.png
http://jamiesjewels.typepad.com/.a/6a0134897dc259970c014e8c176c8d970d-pi

**Benefits:**

- Customize every action-item in the quad menu for your own needs.
- Right click to get to the default quad menu (1).
- Click Ctrl+Rightclick, now a new quad menu will pop up with other options and more commands (2).
- Click Ctrl+shift+Rightclick, now a new quad menu will pop up with other options and more commands (3) etc...
- can also be opened from hotkeys like F9 / customize your own keys.
- At the right side of each item in the menu, there is a custom options icon.. this can open additional options for the item.
- additionally, there could be numbers from 1-10 next to each item. clicking 5 on the keyboard will trigger item 5.

Suddenly you have visual representation of more than 40-100 commands, all categorized. 
You properly forgot most of them, but with this you can access them anytime. - and visually so you wont forget them. Will this help you be more productive?

What do you think?  

Example I created an in Photoshop:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19984581/24357531/428d7782-12fe-11e7-9e99-c750c9527f6d.png)

data.title: [HTML/JS] Syntax highlighting is wrong when </script> is commented out
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2 / 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

The syntax highlighting fails when `// ]]></script>` is in the same line.


![example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19845290/24326440/aa781fba-11ae-11e7-926b-91e897f3ec26.png)

<html>

    <head>
        <title>Example</title>
    </head>
    
    <body>
    
        <script type="text/javascript">// <![CDATA[
        
            var a = 'xy';
        
        // ]]></script>
    
    </body>

</html>

data.title: Add new "files.defaultLanguage" configuration setting
data.body:
This change adds a new configuration setting that sets the default
language mode of new untitled files created with Ctrl+N
(workbench.action.files.newUntitledFile).  This activates the user's
desired language mode when a new untitled file is created.

Fixes #8729.

data.title: [Git] Attempting to rebase interactively with VSC set as default editor does not display all commits
data.body:
As the title says. I swapped my default editor and the commits were shown correctly elsewhere.
I'll note that this is while using VSC terminal
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.13.5|
|vscode-node-readme|bengreenier|1.0.7|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|vscode-exec-node|miramac|0.2.8|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.4.0|;


--- 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set default editor to VSC :  git config --global core.editor "code"
2. Go into Git repo and rebase interactively : git rebase -i head~n 
3. View commits in new window
4. Abort rebase: git rebase --abort
5. Change default editor to whatever
6. Redo steps 2,3

data.title: Feature Request: Commands to move the active tab
data.body:
It seems that vscode doesn't provide any commands for keyboard shortcuts to move the active tab like this:

![screenshot1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1333214/24324942/e11fc1b6-11d2-11e7-9e9d-77262e240421.gif)

I think it would be nice if vscode implements the commands for this behavior.
Currently, there are already similar commands, `workbench.action.moveActiveEditorGroupRight` and `workbench.action.moveActiveEditorGroupLeft`.
Similar, but not same. They work like this:


![screenshot2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1333214/24324943/e5dc7730-11d2-11e7-854f-a6324bd00614.gif)

data.title: Abyss theme changes for view zones
data.body:
I think we should try to tweak the abyss theme colors a little bit provided that we are going to ship them to stable soon. 

Here is how it looks now:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/24324773/6c6f4294-1149-11e7-8a04-542643b5ab34.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/24340030/3747add8-1264-11e7-8211-12323630da5e.png)


Some candidates:
* find input checkbox border looks a bit out of place
* the text foreground color is changed for the selected and non selected entry, I think we should either pick better colors that are closer to the theme or not touch the colors for now
* `editorPeekBorders` does not seem to work, the color of the border is the same as in dark theme
* the outer border now seems to be `2px` instead of `1px`

data.title: Add abstract class snippet
data.body: Provides an alternative (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/23209) fix to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21738. Personally, I think the other fix (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/23209) is better since most snippets don't have comments.

data.title: Remove class snippet comment
data.body: Provides fix for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21738.

data.title: Incorrect fuzzy file finding behavior
data.body:
Here I am searching for the file `wand.ts`. I've already planned to type in `wandts`. I get as far as `wand`, and all is good:

![screen shot 2017-03-25 at 9 10 09 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167745/24322913/777687fa-119f-11e7-8322-736a7f97ecb7.png)

However, once I type the `t`, the ordering of these three matches flips. 

![screen shot 2017-03-25 at 9 10 15 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167745/24322916/82425eac-119f-11e7-86f1-22afef5c577d.png)

That doesn't make any sense to me. Clearly `wand.ts` should still be the top match because the characters I've typed are the closest together in `wand.ts`. 

-------

VSCode Version: 1.10.2
OS Version: macOS Sierra

2. click  View -> Toggle Word Wrap ````no work````

when I edit a html file ,I used a base64 format picture into a style tag，all the string was put in a line,but display in some lines.So I wanna to hit alt+z to  solve it，I have also tried the following settings:
````"editor.wordWrap": "on" ````and```` "editor.wordWrap": "off"````， but nothing happend。**Content still wraps!!!**  ![avatar](http://onb5ufwvw.bkt.clouddn.com/GIF.gif)
